intro: Gardenia posoquerioides, commonly known as the Philippine gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and large, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural collections.
